title.rendered: Will Dubai Overcome Recession in 2023? Facts You Should Know

content.rendered:
Ever since IMF (International Monetary Fund) declared that the world is all set to experience a recession in the year 2023, countries all over the world have been bracing themselves for this change and how it will impact the lives of the people living within the countries.

 

As the world is now trying to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic and deal with the geo-political tensions driven by the Russia-Ukraine War, the signs of a possible recession have been evident for quite some time. Even though it is safe to say that the recession will affect most countries worldwide, not all countries will be impacted in similar fashion.

 

One of the countries that will not face problems due to the recession in the UAE. The country experienced substantial growth in 2022 from the oil and non-oil sectors. Hence, its believed that Dubai will overcome the recession in 2023. Read our recent blog post if you are looking for some tips to start a business with minimum capital in UAE.

 

GDP Growth for Dubai in 2022

The UAE Central Bank stipulated the gross domestic product growth of the nation to be around 7.6%. This boost in the economic sector has been because there has been some growth in non-oil sectors such as real estate, tourism, hospitality, manufacturing, and transportation.

 

The GDP for non-oil sectors grew by 6.1% in the third quarter of 2022, significantly higher than the earlier estimate of 4.3%. Likewise, the GDP for oil products grew by about 11% in 2022. As COVID restrictions were lifted in 2022, it led to the revival of the tourism and hospitality sector. Along with this, there has also been a boom in the construction and real estate sectors. The manufacturing sector also saw significant growth in 2022 and contributed to the national GDP.

 

Global Events in Dubai and Its Role in Economic Growth

Another reason Dubai saw growth in its GDP in recent years is that it has been taking a proactive approach to hosting different global events. The Dubai Expo welcomed millions of people from all parts of the world and paved the way for trading and commercial activities. Dubai Expo also enabled the participating countries to showcase their innovative ideas in almost all spheres. The Global Shapers Dubai Hub is yet another initiative that has contributed to economic development from the grassroots level. Global Shapers Dubai Hub has been responsible for some social and economic development in Dubai by promoting entrepreneurship, innovation, youth engagement, and sustainability. The primary objective of Global Shapers Dubai Hub has been to create environmentally sustainable projects that are also financially and economically rewarding. It also aims to collaborate efficiently with the various segments of the local society.

 

Growth of the Real Estate Property Market in Dubai

Dubai saw tremendous growth in the real estate market in the year 2022, almost close to $4 billion. It shows that Dubai is not only a hot attraction point for foreign investment but well prepared to expand its economic strength without depending too much on its oil reserves. The initiatives taken by the UAE government have also encouraged foreign investors to take an interest in the real estate business in Dubai.

 

Energy Reserves and Their Role in Upholding the Dubai Economy

A large part of Dubai and the UAE’s GDP is driven by sales of hydrocarbons and its energy reserves. It is even more significant as Dubai tries to deal with a fast-changing economy and the challenges posed by the global recession. Even though Dubai has lately focused on achieving growth through non-oil sectors, it is still significantly reliant on its oil reserves. The geo-political conditions of the world and increasing prices of oil are going to be some factors that can influence the GDP of Dubai and the UAE in 2023 and the coming years. Dubai will likely have a significant share of the energy market.

 

Cryptocurrency and Dubai Economy

Dubai is a cryptocurrency investment hub, and investments in this sector have contributed to about 4.3% of the total GDP growth. Indeed, investments in cryptocurrencies are sought with a lot of risks, but the crypto market associated with Dubai will experience further growth in 2023.

 

Dubai is a Major Center for Financial Growth

Dubai and UAE have already taken some crucial measures to effectively diversify the economic growth of the country. The innovative laws and smart policies that Dubai has adopted over the last two years since the pandemic have a decidedly pro-business approach. Therefore, they are bound to drive more investors to be a part of projects taking shape in Dubai. This is why, there is now a chance for Dubai to enjoy sustained economic growth, which can counter the possible effects of the recession. In August 2021, the UAE government launched the UAE Factoring Law and allowed trade finance companies to support small and medium-sized enterprises in UAE so they can come up with greater productivity. It can benefit the economy of Dubai as a whole. The factoring for the non-banking institutions has improved the prospects of Dubai in a significant way. The government is focused on opening up more channels for trade finance so that smaller businesses can expand further and investors can think of business formation in Dubai.

 

The economic resilience of Dubai favors the country when it is trying to recover from the recession. While it is true that the percentage of GDP growth is likely to go down in 2023, this is only temporary, and Dubai will recover soon from it. The independent growth of multiple sectors like tourism and real estate will help Dubai deal with the economic slowdown in a smart way.
